title: Rustc  gives out-of-date/misleading help on macro-backtrace

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
rustc gives out-of-date/misleading help on macro-backtrace.

[This PR](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/f6fc80206e9600ae753cdfbd762fb982afca48b0) seems to have changed the flag (from `external-macro-backtrace` to `macro-backtrace`), but not updated the help.

I tried this code:
```
decl_module! {
	pub struct Module<T: Trait> for enum Call where origin: T::Origin {
		/// The minimum percentage to pay for a bond.
		const MinimumBondPrice: Perbill = T::MinimumBondPrice::get();
		// elided ...
	}
}
```

I expected to see this happen:
Warning that I have missing docs with a note on how to achieve this when it occurs in a macro.

Instead, this happened:
Warning with a misleading help note:
```
warning: missing documentation for a struct
   --> src/lib.rs:348:1
    |
348 | / decl_module! {
349 | |     pub struct Module<T: Trait> for enum Call where origin: T::Origin {
350 | |         /// The minimum percentage to pay for a bond.
351 | |         const MinimumBondPrice: Perbill = T::MinimumBondPrice::get();
...   |
428 | |     }
429 | | }
    | |_^
    |
    = note: this warning originates in a macro outside of the current crate (in Nightly builds, run with -Z external-macro-backtrace for more info)
```
